More recently, the rate of new cases outside of China has outpaced than inside of China, which can be characterized as a pandemic. Since the first report of these cases, more than 375 000 cases have been reported throughout the world and up to one‐seventh of them came from Wuhan, a city of Hubei Province in China.
2 The epidemic in China peaked between late January and late February 2020. The infection for this patient's case occurred in this period and despite the special feature of his underlying severe haemophilia A, his clinical course is typical among the susceptible populations in Wuhan.
